definition: A fruit that is red or green.
example: I eat an apple every day.

definition: A building where people live.
example: They bought a new house.

definition: The star at the center of our solar system.
example: The sun is shining brightly.

definition: A set of written, printed, or blank pages fastened together.
example: She is reading a book.

definition: A woody plant with branches.
example: The tree gives us shade.

definition: A domesticated animal that barks.
example: My dog loves to play.

definition: A piece of furniture for sitting.
example: Sit on the chair.

definition: A device for communication.
example: I called him on the phone.

definition: An electronic device for processing data.
example: She works on a computer.

definition: A large body of salt water.
example: The ocean waves are high.

definition: A place where students learn.
example: Children go to school every morning.

definition: A person who educates students.
example: My teacher is kind.

definition: A piece of furniture with a flat top.
example: Put the books on the table.

definition: A device for telling time.
example: The clock shows 3 PM.

definition: A large landform that rises above the ground.
example: They climbed the mountain.

definition: A large stream of water.
example: The river flows into the sea.

definition: A flying vehicle.
example: We traveled by airplane.

definition: A large animal with a trunk.
example: The elephant is the largest land animal.

definition: A musical instrument with strings.
example: He plays the guitar.

definition: A person who treats sick people.
example: The doctor examined the patient.

definition: Water falling from clouds.
example: It is raining outside.

definition: The natural satellite of the Earth.
example: The moon shines at night.

definition: A large town.
example: New York is a big city.

definition: A celestial body orbiting a star.
example: Earth is a planet.

definition: A fixed luminous point in the night sky.
example: The star shines brightly.

definition: Combustion or burning.
example: The fire is hot.

definition: A civil force for maintaining public order.
example: The police officer arrested the thief.

definition: A place for treating sick people.
example: She works at the hospital.

definition: A building containing books.
example: He borrowed a book from the library.

definition: A place where goods are sold.
example: She bought shoes from the store.

definition: A large public garden.
example: They went for a walk in the park.

definition: A place where animals are kept.
example: They visited the zoo.

definition: A pebbly or sandy shore.
example: They went to the beach for vacation.

definition: A motion picture.
example: They watched a movie at the cinema.

definition: A theater where movies are shown.
example: They watched a movie at the cinema.

definition: A building where plays are performed.
example: They watched a play at the theater.

definition: A building where objects of historical, scientific, or artistic interest are kept.
example: They visited the museum.

definition: A piece of ground for growing flowers, fruit, or vegetables.
example: She planted flowers in the garden.

definition: A place where people pay to sit and eat meals.
example: They had dinner at a restaurant.

definition: A small restaurant selling light meals and drinks.
example: They had coffee at the cafe.

definition: A place where alcoholic drinks are served.
example: They went to the bar for a drink.

definition: A large self-service store selling food and household goods.
example: She bought groceries at the supermarket.

definition: A regular gathering of people for the purchase and sale of provisions, livestock, and other commodities.
example: They went to the market to buy fruits.

definition: A place where mail is received, sorted, and sent.
example: She mailed the letter at the post office.

definition: A place where aircraft regularly land and take off.
example: They arrived at the airport.

definition: A place where trains stop to pick up and drop off passengers.
example: They took the train from the station.

definition: A place where buses stop to pick up and drop off passengers.
example: They waited for the bus at the station.

definition: A car that carries passengers for a fare.
example: They took a taxi to the airport.

definition: A vehicle with four wheels.
example: She drives a red car.

definition: A vehicle with two wheels.
example: He rides a bicycle to work.

definition: A two-wheeled vehicle that is powered by a motor.
example: He rides a motorcycle to work.

definition: A small domesticated carnivorous mammal.
example: The cat is sleeping on the couch.

definition: A staple food made from flour, water, and yeast.
example: She bought a loaf of bread from the bakery.

definition: Vocal or instrumental sounds combined to produce beauty of form.
example: He listens to music while working.

definition: The seed-bearing part of a plant.
example: She picked a flower from the garden.

definition: A person whom one knows and with whom one has a bond of mutual affection.
example: He is my best friend.

definition: A system for transmitting visual images and sound that are reproduced on screens.
example: We watch the news on television.

definition: A global computer network providing a variety of information and communication facilities.
example: I use the internet to research information.

definition: An instrument for writing or drawing, consisting of a thin stick of graphite enclosed in wood.
example: She sharpened her pencil before the exam.

definition: A material manufactured in thin sheets from the pulp of wood or other fibrous substances.
example: He wrote his essay on a piece of paper.

definition: A device for recording visual images in the form of photographs or video.
example: She took a picture with her camera.

definition: A covering for the foot, typically made of leather, having a sturdy sole and not reaching above the ankle.
example: He bought a new pair of shoes.

definition: A shaped covering for the head worn for warmth, as a fashion item, or as part of a uniform.
example: She wore a hat to protect herself from the sun.

definition: A pair of lenses set in a frame resting on the nose and ears, used to correct or assist defective eyesight.
example: He needs glasses to read.

definition: A flexible container with an opening at the top, used for carrying things.
example: She packed her bag for the trip.

definition: A small piece of shaped metal with incisions cut to fit the wards of a particular lock.
example: He lost his house key.

definition: A hinged, sliding, or revolving barrier at the entrance to a building, room, or vehicle.
example: Please close the door behind you.

definition: An opening in the wall or roof of a building or vehicle that is fitted with glass or other transparent material.
example: She opened the window to let in some fresh air.

definition: A reflective surface, now typically of glass coated with a metal amalgam, that reflects a clear image.
example: He looked at himself in the mirror.

definition: A device for giving light, either one consisting of an electric bulb together with its holder and shade or cover.
example: She turned on the lamp to read her book.

definition: A piece of furniture for sleep or rest, typically a framework with a mattress.
example: He went to bed early last night.

definition: A large piece of woolen or similar material used as a bed covering or other covering for warmth.
example: She wrapped herself in a blanket to keep warm.

definition: A rectangular cloth bag stuffed with feathers, foam rubber, or other soft materials, used to support the head when lying down.
example: He rested his head on the pillow.

definition: A small bowl-shaped container for drinking from, typically having a handle.
example: She poured tea into the cup.

definition: A flat dish, typically circular and made of china, from which food is eaten or served.
example: He placed the food on the plate.

definition: An implement with two or more prongs used for lifting food to the mouth or holding it when cutting.
example: She used a fork to eat her salad.

definition: An instrument composed of a blade fixed into a handle, used for cutting or as a weapon.
example: He used a knife to cut the bread.

definition: An implement consisting of a small, shallow oval or round bowl on a long handle, used for eating, stirring, and serving food.
example: She stirred her coffee with a spoon.

definition: A container with a narrow neck, used for storing liquids.
example: He drank water from a bottle.

definition: A hard, brittle substance, typically transparent or translucent, made by fusing sand with soda and lime.
example: She filled the glass with juice.

definition: A container with a flat base and sides, typically square or rectangular and having a lid.
example: He packed his books into a box.

definition: Luggage; suitcases and bags containing personal belongings packed for traveling.
example: She checked her baggage at the airport.

definition: A piece of paper or card that gives the holder a certain right, especially to enter a place, travel by public transport, or participate in an event.
example: He bought a ticket for the concert.

definition: An official document issued by a government, certifying the holder's identity and citizenship and entitling them to travel under its protection to and from foreign countries.
example: She renewed her passport before the trip.

definition: A pocket-sized flat folding case for holding money and plastic cards.
example: He lost his wallet at the park.

definition: A current medium of exchange in the form of coins and banknotes.
example: She saved enough money to buy a car.

definition: A small plastic card issued by a bank, business, etc., allowing the holder to purchase goods or services on credit.
example: He paid for the meal with his credit card.

definition: An establishment for the custody, loan, exchange, or issue of money, for the extension of credit, and for facilitating the transmission of funds.
example: She deposited her paycheck at the bank.

definition: An automated teller machine, a computerized telecommunications device that enables the clients of a financial institution to perform financial transactions.
example: He withdrew cash from the ATM.

definition: A written order to a bank to pay a stated sum from the drawer's account.
example: She wrote a check to pay the bill.

definition: A piece of paper acknowledging that something has been received.
example: He kept the receipt as proof of purchase.

definition: A statement of money owed for goods or services.
example: She paid the electricity bill.

definition: A compulsory contribution to state revenue, levied by the government on workers' income and business profits.
example: He filed his tax return last week.

definition: A fixed regular payment, typically paid on a monthly basis but often expressed as an annual sum, made by an employer to an employee.
example: She received her salary at the end of the month.

definition: A paid position of regular employment.
example: He applied for a job at the new company.

definition: Activity involving mental or physical effort done in order to achieve a purpose or result.
example: She has a lot of work to do before the deadline.

definition: A room, set of rooms, or building used as a place for commercial, professional, or bureaucratic work.
example: He works in an office downtown.

definition: An assembly of people for a particular purpose, especially for formal discussion.
example: She attended a meeting with her colleagues.

definition: A speech or talk in which a new product, idea, or piece of work is shown and explained to an audience.
example: He gave a presentation on the new project.

definition: An individual or collaborative enterprise that is carefully planned to achieve a particular aim.
example: She is working on a new project at work.

definition: The latest time or date by which something should be completed.
example: He finished the report just before the deadline.

definition: A plan for carrying out a process or procedure, giving lists of intended events and times.
example: She checked her schedule for the day.

definition: An arrangement to meet someone at a particular time and place.
example: He has an appointment with the doctor.

definition: A period of suspension of work, study, or other activity, usually used for rest, recreation, or travel.
example: They went on vacation to the beach.

definition: A day of festivity or recreation when no work is done.
example: Christmas is a public holiday in many countries.

definition: A social gathering of invited guests, typically involving eating, drinking, and entertainment.
example: She hosted a party for her birthday.

definition: The action of marking one's pleasure at an important event or occasion by engaging in enjoyable, typically social, activity.
example: They held a celebration for the company's anniversary.

definition: A thing given willingly to someone without payment; a present.
example: He received a gift for his birthday.

definition: A piece of thick, stiff paper or thin pasteboard, in particular one used for writing or printing on.
example: She sent a card to her friend.

definition: A written or verbal request inviting someone to go somewhere or to do something.
example: He received an invitation to the wedding.

definition: A person who is invited to visit someone's home or attend a particular social occasion.
example: They welcomed their guests at the door.

definition: A person who receives or entertains other people as guests.
example: She was the host of the party.

definition: The main meal of the day, taken either around midday or in the evening.
example: They had dinner at a fancy restaurant.

definition: A meal eaten in the middle of the day.
example: He had lunch with his colleagues.

definition: A meal eaten in the morning, the first of the day.
example: She had toast and coffee for breakfast.

definition: A small amount of food eaten between meals.
example: He grabbed a snack from the fridge.

definition: A sweet course eaten at the end of a meal.
example: They had ice cream for dessert.

definition: An item of soft sweet food made from a mixture of flour, fat, eggs, sugar, and other ingredients, baked and often decorated.
example: She baked a cake for the party.

definition: A sweet food made with sugar or syrup combined with fruit, chocolate, or nuts.
example: He bought some candy at the store.

definition: A food in the form of a paste or solid block made from roasted and ground cacao seeds, typically sweetened and eaten as a snack.
example: She loves to eat chocolate.

definition: A soft frozen food made with sweetened and flavored milk fat.
example: They had ice cream for dessert.

definition: The liquid obtained from or present in fruit or vegetables.
example: She poured herself a glass of orange juice.

definition: A hot drink made from the roasted and ground seeds of a tropical shrub.
example: He drinks coffee every morning.

definition: A hot drink made by infusing the dried, crushed leaves of the tea plant in boiling water.
example: She drinks tea with honey.

definition: A colorless, transparent, odorless liquid that forms the seas, lakes, rivers, and rain and is the basis of the fluids of living organisms.
example: She drinks water throughout the day.
